abstract: Editorial contends that analysis of executions that have been carried out in the United States since death penalty was reinstated in 1976 show it to be the embodiment of arbitrariness; holds that latest Gallup poll results, showing public support for capital punishment to be at its lowest since 1972, are evidence that death penalty does not reflect American values and must be abolished.
snippet: More Americans seem to be recognizing that killing a prisoner is not the only way to make sure he is never released and that capital punishment is indefensible.
lead_paragraph: More Americans seem to be recognizing that killing a prisoner is not the only way to make sure he is never released and that capital punishment is indefensible.
